data.title: My Favorite Pizza in Florida!
data.text:
Every trip I make to South Florida requires a stop at Anthony's for Pizza. Luckily there is one within walking distance of our house. This year I got to enjoy it watching the Super bowl with a frosty Yuengling Lager. An unbeatable footlball game combo!
Pizza at Anthony's is always "well done" and the coal fire oven produces a nice char on the crust. My favorite topping is the Meatballs and Ricotta combination. I have tried to duplicate this with pizza places back home, but nobody does it quite like Anthony's.  Savory pork meatballs and generous dollops of Ricotta cheese top their crispy (yet chewy) crust and their tomato sauce is herby and delicious! Salads are pretty standard (but nice and fresh) and their wings have an interesting "Mediterranean"(?) spice profile (nothing like the Buffalo wings that are most common where I live) The arugula topping on the pizza is an interesting option and worth the extra $ if you are a fan. 
Service is fast whether you eat in or takeout. Wish I had an Anthony's I could get to year round!

data.title: excellent choice of eatery
data.text: The food is delicious but expensive. Must try the chicken wings and pizza of course and salad is yummy

data.title: mummified wngs
data.text: I used to love eating here but no more, dried out almost burnt wings and the pizza was amateur. I dislike being served left over wings and what happened pizzas. the salad was ok.

data.title: Burnt pizza leather!
data.text:
Lunch at Anthony's was an experience......mostly bad.  The potential for a great experience has not been achieved.  A clean pub-like facility with a good selection of beers and wine.  The server was a rather cheeky and short-tempered young woman who left the impression that the only opinion of importance was hers.  The draft beer was served with an orange wedge on it??!!  The pizza and calzone were burned and leathery, although  abundant portions were   served.  An accidental oversight resulting in an incorrect bill topped off this forgettable experience in Wellington, 
FL.  Re

data.title: Best thing to happen to Wellington in a long time!
data.text: Fast, friendly and delicious. That's all you need to know about this great litle pizza joint!  My wife and I spent less than $30 on a wonderful pizza with a couple of ice-cold Peronni's, and we will be going  back often.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Great marguerite pizza. Coupons in local magazines. More than just a pizza place.  Lasagna is very tasty.  Family atmosphere.

data.title: Must go
data.text: They have great wings and Pizza! Small menu but sure you will find something you like!

data.title: Not the best pizza I've ever had
data.text: Call me a critic, but if the only thing on your sit-down restaurant's menu is pizza, it had better be the best pizza I ever had! This pizza is alright, but not the best in town...
